reviewText: Movie starts with good tension and mystery, but then the gig is up.  Several people wake up in a commercial airplane but none know how they got there. Oh, oh, the earth below is being consumed by nuclear apocalypse. The news on the one smart phone aboard tell of how big cities are being erased from the map. But how is it that those aboard were saved?  And their families below?Quickly there appear many inconsistencies on this miraculous saving of their lives, and we the viewers, as well as the characters, want answers.  As the answers trickle in (well before the half-way mark on the film), the thriller potential quickly deflates like a tire with a big cut on the side. Is the government involved in this miraculous rescue of these few folks on this airplane?  Why? So, not only is there NO CLIMAX in this movie, but the tension starts to erode at around the midpoint. To make matters worse, the ending is ambiguous and totally unsatisfying for the viewer.  Skip this low-budget dog.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It gets your mind wondering about what is really going on in this world...who are they and is this really happening?

reviewText: Interesting story line although somewhat unbelievable. Hey! This is Hollywood. Ending leaves you searching for answers.Barely 3 stars. Truck driver steals the show.
summary: More exciting if you have a fear of flying.

reviewText: I gotta say I didn't expect this movie to be so good.  It reminds me a lot of "The Langoliers", only with much better acting and no supernatural elements.  Something about airplanes just makes them great for a horror setting.  The claustraphobia, feeling of helplessness, and total lack of control can create a great atmosphere of terror and suspense.I would have preferred a more conclusive ending, but overall this was quite enjoyable.
summary: A surprisingly good low-budget mystery thriller

reviewText: I have nothing but praise for "Chariot." It was very well written, acted, and filmed! My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the movie, which was extremely suspenseful and thrilling. It kept our attention throughout! I couldn't help but think that it would have made a very exciting Twilight Zone or Outer Limits episode, as well. It had a very scary and realistic storyline.So, if you like a very GOOD, cozy, mystery and suspense thriller, don't miss out on "Chariot." See it.
summary: A good solid, well-acted, mystery and suspense thriller!

I would not recommend this movie to anyone!

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: Seven people wake up on a stolen 727 not knowing what is going on. With the use of a limited cell phone, they figure out the US is under attack and they were selected to be saved. The problem is that their destination has been destroyed and the pilots refuse contact with anyone. Upon opening the cockpit door, the pilot has orders to shoot to kill.The whole thing was ill conceived. Their reaction was atypical. Once you know the whole tale, the film goes from bad to worse. Nothing like spending an hour watching people having anxiety attacks. 2 stars is generous. Not recommended even as a rental.Parental Guide: No sex or nudity or F-bombs that I can recall.
Title: N/A
